column2: Role & responsibilities     Product Demonstration: Conduct engaging and informative product demonstrations for school administrators, teachers, and students to showcase the effectiveness of our experiential science learning programs. Orientation and Training: Provide comprehensive orientation and training sessions to school teachers on effectively integrating our science learning programs into the school curriculum. School Service Coordinator: Offer continuous support and assistance to all client school teachers throughout the academic year and ensure effective implementation of the academic programmes. Impact creation - Collaborate with team lead to develop and implement effective strategies for maximising the impact of our programs in client schools. Content Development: Collaborate with fellow science educators to develop engaging and interactive content for our science learning programs. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's degree in Education, Science, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 1 year of teaching experience in schools. Previous experience in teaching outreach, curriculum development, or teaching is preferred. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage and inspire diverse audiences. Strong organisational and project management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritise effectively. Flexibility to travel to schools and educational events as needed. Perks and benefits   ThinkTac is incubated by the "Valley School" and extensive support from Dr. C V Raman's family (Raman Research Institute Trust). Innovation and Learning around experiential STEM pedagogy will be given. Also, ThinkTac works closely with CBSE and other boards to shape public education policy and competency assessment protocols. The role can be Office-based/ Remote, and ThinkTac offers flexible working arrangements for women specifically to balance life, family and professional objectives.   Click here to Apply  https://bit.ly/SCIedu24
column11: Science, Pedagogy, Academics, Coaching, Education, Mathematics, Teaching, Curriculum Development, STEM

column2: Job Title : Home Tutor Job Summary : BYJU'S is seeking individuals with a passion for teaching who may not have the availability for full-time commitment but are eager to engage in part-time teaching. If you possess the ability to impart knowledge with patience and finesse, we invite you to become a valuable part of our team.  We are looking for part-time teachers who can provide in-person home tuition, visiting students at their homes. Embrace the opportunity to Learn, Unlearn, and Relearn together, regardless of your experience   Advantages of working with BYJU'S Home Tuition Flexibility to pick favorable day and time slots based on Parents demand Continuous opportunity to add more students based on Teachers availability ( opportunity will be shared with area details )  Comprehensive support with all the curriculum and doubts related to course Help and support with planning and scheduling classes with student    Responsibilities Comprehending the Current School Curriculum Conducting Individualized Concept-Based Teaching Providing Assistance with School Assignments Developing Comprehensive Study Plans for Future Learning Monitoring and Evaluating Student Performance, including homework and exam results Recognizing and Addressing Special Learning Needs Assigning Engaging Homework and Exercises Maintaining Attendance and Grade Records for Students Establishing Trusting Rapport with Students and Parents Communicating Student Progress to Parents   Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in Science, Engineering, Technology, or Mathematics. Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Science, Engineering, Technology, or Mathematics. Proficient in effective teaching methods. Familiarity with the national curriculum. Hiring for Grade 4 to 10              Science & Math (Grade 4 to 10)   Job Type:  Part-time (Depending on your availability) Schedule: Days: Monday to Sunday Timings: Evening 4 PM  10 PM Salary:  Per class rate (upto INR 220/-) Language Preference: English (Preferred) Knowledge of regional language will be a great add-on

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and passionate Computing Educator to join our team at the Coding Academy supported by Telangana Social Welfare Residential Educational Institutions Society in Telangana. The Coding Academy has two strategic academic units: a school located in Moinabad Rangareddy district for grades 6-12, and a college located in Shamirpet, Medchal-Malkajgiri district.     The successful candidate will be responsible for planning and delivering the computing curriculum for learners of the degree college, as well as supporting the Foundation s work in computing curriculum research and development, teacher training, and related teaching and learning activities.     The role requires a deep understanding of computing subjects, pedagogical principles, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with colleagues.       Key responsibilities:         Teach the Raspberry Pi Foundations Computing Curriculum to the learners of the degree college by following the pedagogical principles laid out in the content     Prepare, conduct, and evaluate internal assessments     Create and sustain an inspiring, inclusive learning environment in the classroom      Motivate learners to ask, innovate, experiment and explore, encouraging their curiosity and creativity     Plan and support learners to ideate and create projects for various state-/national-/global-level events and competitions in related fields     Observe learners responses and record them for further actions, providing feedback to learners and working to improve their learning outcomes         Collaborate closely with the team at the Raspberry Pi Foundation to understand the critical observations made during teaching, test the curriculum, and integrate computing education research and industry trends and topics into lessons         Collaborate with other fellow educators to bring in more synergy     Engage with the other teachers at the Coding Academy for effective implementation and support      Collaborate closely with industry experts and senior computer science educators to organise special sessions, workshops, and industry visits     Act as a point of contact for state educators on behalf of the Raspberry Pi Foundation, and nurture an educator community         Experience and personal attributes       We recognise that everyone has the potential for growth, and we welcome applications from candidates who can demonstrate that they have some, but not all, of the experience and personal attributes listed here.       A commitment to the mission and values of the Raspberry Pi Foundation     Substantial teaching and learning experience, with experience of designing and delivering effective and engaging lesson plans, ideally with a specialism in computing education (Bachelors degree in Computer Science or a related field and a teaching qualification is highly preferred)     A proven record of delivering solutions to the formal education system, primarily degree college, and understanding of the relevant/critical success factors     A demonstrable record of success in areas such as curriculum research and development, monitoring and evaluation, and training of teachers     A passion for using best-practice pedagogy and research-informed practice in the classroom     Familiarity with online learning experiences and products, with an understanding of how technology is changing learning is preferable     Ability to engage with and manage critical school stakeholders during programme implementation work     Excellent verbal and written communication skills: proficient in reading, writing, and verbal communication in English with a fair level of proficiency in Telugu     A collaborative, flexible, and solutions-focused approach, with the ability to manage conflicting priorities and complexities     Good data, analytical, and reporting skills, and the ability to use data effectively to improve what we do     Willingness to work flexible hours to better cater to the local project requirements     Comfortable with commuting to the Coding Academy, and owning a vehicle is preferred

column2: We are currently in search of dedicated and qualified Home Tutors specializing in Math and Science in Raipur, Chhattisgarh.       Position Description:         As a Home Tutor, your primary responsibility will be to teach Math and Science to students in grades 4-10, aligning with the CBSE and ICSE curriculum.     You will be conducting one-on-one classes directly at the students homes, providing a personalized and convenient learning experience.     Your role encompasses the creation of engaging lesson plans, the facilitation of interactive and informative sessions, and offering valuable guidance to your students.         Timing:         Home Tutors are expected to work for 0 upto 4 teaching hours per day. This includes the time spent with students in one-on-one sessions.     Additionally, you should account for traveling time between different tutoring locations when planning your schedule.         Requirements:         A minimum qualification of a Bachelors degree in Science or Mathematics (eg, B.Sc, B.Tech, M.Sc, etc).     A profound and comprehensive understanding of Math and Science, particularly up to grade 10, is a prerequisite.     Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills are essential for building rapport with students.         Additional Information:         Candidates must be residents of Raipur, Chhattisgarh.     Having a motorcycle or scooter for commuting between different tutoring locations is mandatory for Home Tutors.
